body:
Hello @jbrockmendel! Thanks for updating the PR.

 - In the file [`pandas/core/frame.py`](https://github.com/jbrockmendel/pandas/blob/914fd806114048b6368378f0e0938d65b64eeb39/pandas/core/frame.py), following                are the PEP8 issues :
> [Line 4927:15](https://github.com/jbrockmendel/pandas/blob/914fd806114048b6368378f0e0938d65b64eeb39/pandas/core/frame.py#L4927): [W504](https://duckduckgo.com/?q=pep8%20W504) line break after binary operator
> [Line 4936:15](https://github.com/jbrockmendel/pandas/blob/914fd806114048b6368378f0e0938d65b64eeb39/pandas/core/frame.py#L4936): [W504](https://duckduckgo.com/?q=pep8%20W504) line break after binary operator
> [Line 4937:15](https://github.com/jbrockmendel/pandas/blob/914fd806114048b6368378f0e0938d65b64eeb39/pandas/core/frame.py#L4937): [W504](https://duckduckgo.com/?q=pep8%20W504) line break after binary operator
> [Line 4954:15](https://github.com/jbrockmendel/pandas/blob/914fd806114048b6368378f0e0938d65b64eeb39/pandas/core/frame.py#L4954): [W504](https://duckduckgo.com/?q=pep8%20W504) line break after binary operator


 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/core/internals/blocks.py`](https://github.com/jbrockmendel/pandas/blob/914fd806114048b6368378f0e0938d65b64eeb39/pandas/core/internals/blocks.py) !

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/core/internals/managers.py`](https://github.com/jbrockmendel/pandas/blob/914fd806114048b6368378f0e0938d65b64eeb39/pandas/core/internals/managers.py) !

 - In the file [`pandas/core/ops.py`](https://github.com/jbrockmendel/pandas/blob/914fd806114048b6368378f0e0938d65b64eeb39/pandas/core/ops.py), following                are the PEP8 issues :
> [Line 1727:11](https://github.com/jbrockmendel/pandas/blob/914fd806114048b6368378f0e0938d65b64eeb39/pandas/core/ops.py#L1727): [W504](https://duckduckgo.com/?q=pep8%20W504) line break after binary operator
> [Line 1728:11](https://github.com/jbrockmendel/pandas/blob/914fd806114048b6368378f0e0938d65b64eeb39/pandas/core/ops.py#L1728): [W504](https://duckduckgo.com/?q=pep8%20W504) line break after binary operator




##### Comment last updated on October 03, 2018 at 21:58 Hours UTC

Likely the easiest way to address the inconsistencies (and ugliness that goes with it) would be to call `_align_method_FRAME` in `ops._comp_method_FRAME`.  It is called in the other two FRAME functions but not that one.

> **Legend** - [Click here to learn more](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/codecov-delta)
> `Δ = absolute <relative> (impact)`, `ø = not affected`, `? = missing data`
> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/22751?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [ee80803...914fd80](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/22751?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).

I am personally a bit hesitant to do much refactoring on something rather fragile as broadcasting behaviour without some better testing/documenting of the actual/desired broadcasting behaviour (but it might be a good opportunity to actually do that!).

> I am personally a bit hesitant to do much refactoring on something rather fragile as broadcasting 

I definitely agree.  In case it is not clear, this PR is _not_ intended to be merged in its present form.  The  idea behind the ugly, verbose implementation here is to show precisely what behavior is currently tested.  The discussion I'm hoping for is to clarify what the "spec" is supposed to be so that can be documented/tested and then implemented cleanly.

OK, good to hear. 

> The idea behind the ugly, verbose implementation here is to show precisely what behavior is currently tested. The discussion I'm hoping for is to clarify what the "spec" is supposed to be so that can be documented/tested and then implemented cleanly.

I think it would be a good idea to try to translate the 'ugly code' you wrote now to a written explanation of the broadcasting rules.
